current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To permanently extend the Protecting Tenants at
		  Foreclosure Act of 2009 and establish a private right of action to enforce
		  compliance with such Act.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Permanently Protecting Tenants at
			 Foreclosure Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 704 of the
			 Protecting Tenants at Foreclosure Act of 2009
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting Tenants at Foreclosure Act of 2009/s:704

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Protecting Tenants
			 at Foreclosure Act of 2009
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting Tenants at Foreclosure Act of 2009

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, is further
			 amended by adding at the end the following new section:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Permanently Protecting Tenants at Foreclosure Act of 2013/s:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may bring a civil action in a
				court of competent jurisdiction for damages resulting from such violation, and
				may obtain other appropriate relief, including equitable relief. If the
				plaintiff prevails in any such action, the court shall award the plaintiff any
				litigation costs reasonably incurred, together with reasonable attorneys’ fees
				and reasonable expert witness fees, as determined by the court.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting Tenants at Foreclosure Act of 2009/s:704/ss:b

				by a violation referred to in

Protecting Tenants at Foreclosure Act of 2009/s:703
